quests: Quest for Eurydice - Journey to underworld
Argonautica - Sailed with Jason and the Argonauts
Descent to Hades - Attempted rescue from death
Music journey - Used music to charm all beings

aristaeus: Whose pursuit of Eurydice led to her death
father: in most traditions) or Oeagrus (King of Thrace)
dionysus: (in some versions) Who incited the Maenads against him

name: Greek Mythology
attributes: Son of Apollo/Oeagrus and Calliope, Prophet of the Mysteries, Prince of Thrace, The Enchanter
Music, poetry, prophecy, mysteries, healing through song, eloquence
Lyre (seven-stringed), laurel wreath, tortoise (lyre's shell origin)
All creatures were subject to his music—lions, serpents, birds, even the beasts of the wild
Thrace, Lesbos (where his head washed ashore), various Orphic temples
All creatures were subject to his music—lions
even the beasts of the wild
weapons: Lyre - Made by Hermes, most powerful magical instrument
Music - Could charm gods and beasts alike
description:
Discover the legendary heroes, warriors, and mortal champions.

allies.name: Hades   Offered Chance To Reclaim Eurydice

enemies.name: The Maenads   Killed Orpheus In Madness

abilities: Magic music - Controlled all beings through song
Animal control - Charmed beasts with music
Underworld navigation - Traveled safely through Hades

parentage.divine: Apollo - God of music, sun, and prophecy
parentage.mortal: Calliope - Muse of epic poetry (in some versions)
